definition: to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: Do not be hasty when climbing, sit for a while if you get tired.
sentences.chinese: 登山的时候不能急，累了就小坐片刻。

sentences.english: From ancient times, there has been only one path going toward the temple which is named "Xiangyun road."
sentences.chinese: 上慧济寺必须从一条古老的香云路登山。

sentences.english: On the half way to the mountain, the tourists had a rest and snacked on some bread.
sentences.chinese: 在登山的途中，游客们休息了会儿，吃了点儿面包。

sentences.english: I could never be a mountaineer; I have no head for heights .
sentences.chinese: 我永远也当不了登山运动员，因为我不能登高。

sentences.english: Finally there's Mountain Climbing and the alpine climbing games.
sentences.chinese: 最后介绍的是登山运动和阿尔卑斯攀登。

sentences.english: Climbers on the artificial climbing wall on the Diga diLuzzone dam in Tessin, Switzerland
sentences.chinese: 登山者在瑞士提契诺州的人工攀岩墙上。

sentences.english: The climber traversed a long horizontal crack in the face of the mountain slope.
sentences.chinese: 登山者横贯了山脉斜坡表面一段长的水平裂缝。

sentences.english: Italian manufacturer of hiking and mountaineering footwear.
sentences.chinese: 意大利制造商的徒步旅行和登山鞋。

sentences.english: The mountaineers' spirits kept up against heavy odds.
sentences.chinese: 在非常不利的条件下，登山运动员们仍然情绪高涨。

sentences.english: The mountain climber could not find many footholds on the melting ice.
sentences.chinese: 登山者在融化的冰上找不到多少立足之处。

sentences.english: The cook served out tins of food to all the mountaineers.
sentences.chinese: 炊事员把罐头食品分给所有登山队员。

sentences.english: Do wipe the rubber clean with a damp cloth if the shoes get dirty.
sentences.chinese: 如果您的登山鞋脏了，要用湿抹布擦拭橡胶部分。

sentences.english: The picnickers hired some warm clothes for a trip up the mountain top.
sentences.chinese: 旅行人为登山顶而租用一些保暖衣服。

sentences.english: Don't dice with death by climbing up the mountain in such bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 在这样恶劣的天气情况下，别冒险玩命去登山。

sentences.english: Finally in 1975, the team went to climb the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 个女队员进行训练，筹集登山的资金。

sentences.english: The climbers were roped together when they crossed the glacier.
sentences.chinese: 登山的人在过冰川时相互用绳子系在一起。

definition: to climb/to pull oneself up/to clamber/to scale/fig. to forge ahead in the face of hardships and danger
to go uphill/to spin cocoon (silkworms)/to pass away
abbr. for 珠穆朗瑪峰|珠穆朗玛峰, Mt Chomolungma or Qomolangma (Tibetan)/Mt Everest/Nepalese: Sagarmatha
to ride (a bicycle, horse, motorbike etc)/cycling/horseback riding/motorbike riding/a ride/CL:次[ci4]
